remarks: Axiom of Continuity.  Axiom A11 of [Schwabhauser] p. 13. This axiom (scheme) asserts that any two sets ` S ` and ` T ` (of points) such that the elements of ` S ` precede the elements of ` T ` with respect to some point ` a ` (that is, ` x ` is between ` a ` and ` y ` whenever ` x ` is in ` X ` and ` y ` is in ` Y ` ) are separated by some point ` b ` ; this is explained in Axiom 11 of [Tarski1999] p. 185. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 16-Mar-2019.)
